poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: My body clock Six hours out. Five minutes’ sleep And there you were. From The palace of congress A whaleback piazza Downtown The casbah was awash. We found A teashop, colour of canvas, Drank espresso at the counter; That was it. I don’t see A word between us, Words about us, yes There were: Ah, the inseparables! Which we’re not Or is the bee In his little heart Never anywhere else Never anywhere but In the nodding moment That picked him out.
